org.quickconnect
Class QuickConnect

java.lang.Object
  org.quickconnect.QuickConnect

public class QuickConnect
extends java.lang.Object

The QuickConnect class is used to create control stacks and execute them. Control stacks consist a few types of objects that all implement the ControlObject interface. These types are:

  1. ValCO Validation Control Objects - these stacks objects are used to validate values that will be used later in other control objects. The items validated are usually passed in as parameters. By convention names for objects of this type end with ValCO.
  2. BCO Business Control Objects - these stack objects are used to interact with databases, remote servers, files, and are also used to do data manipulation/computation. By convention names for objects of this type end with BCO.
  3. VCOView Control Objects - these stack objects are used to do user interface updates.
  4. ECOError Control Objects - these stack objects are used to notify the user of errors and do any view cleanup required if an bad data or an error/exception occurs during the execution of a stack. By convention names for objects of this type end with VCO.
An example of a login stack could include the following control objects:
  • CredentialsValCO - the handleIt method performs length/content validation on the user name and password. Returns either true or false
  • GetUserCO - the handleIt method queries the database to see if a user exists with the validated user name and password. Returns the user, if any, or null.
  • LoginSuccessVCO - the handleIt method updates the UI.

    • Author:
    Lee S. Barney

    QuickConnect

    Method Detail

    handleRequest

    public static void handleRequest(java.lang.String command,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> parameters)
    This method is the Control Object trigger. Call it from anywhere in your code to execute any stack created using the mapCommandTo** methods.

    Parameters:
    command - - the command string that is the key associated with the desired Command Object stack.
    parameters - - an ArrayList containing any values you wish to pass to all Command Objects' in the stack. This ArrayList appears as the 'paramters' value passed into all Command Objects in the stack.

    handleError

    public static void handleError(java.lang.String command,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> parameters)
    This method is similar to handleRequest but is used to trigger stacks made of Error Control Objects. Call it from anywhere in your code where you wish to trigger a specified error handling stack. It is common to call this method from within Validation Control Objects if validation fails prior to returning false to terminate execution of the stack. It is also common to call this method from within Business Control Objects when data retrieved from remote sources or local databases is not what it should be.

    Parameters:
    command - - the command string that is the key associated with the desired Error Command Object stack.
    parameters - - an ArrayList containing any values you wish to pass to all Error Command Objects' in the stack. This ArrayList appears as the 'paramters' value passed into all Error Command Objects in the stack.

    mapCommandToBCO

    public static void mapCommandToBCO(java.lang.String command,
                                   java.lang.Class handlerClass)
    This method maps a specific command to a Business Control Object (BCO). BCOs are used to retrieve data from remote sources, local databases, and do data manipulation/calculation.

    Parameters:
    command - - the key used to identify the stack to which the specific BCO is to be mapped.
    handlerClass - - the class of BCO to be added to the stack. There may be as many different kinds of these added as needed.

    mapCommandToVCO

    public static void mapCommandToVCO(java.lang.String command,
                                   java.lang.Class handlerClass)
    This method maps a specific command to a View Control Object (VCO). VCOs are used to update the user interface based on the data collected and calculated in the BCOs in the same stack. VCOs are executed in the UI thread for Android and Java SE implementations. No threading is done for Java EE since Java EE applications are already threaded.

    Parameters:
    command - - the key used to identify the stack to which the specific VCO is to be mapped.
    handlerClass - - the class of VCO to be added to the stack. There may be as many different kinds of these added as needed.

    mapCommandToValCO

    public static void mapCommandToValCO(java.lang.String command,
                                     java.lang.Class handlerClass)
    This method maps a specific command to a Validation Control Object (ValCO). ValCOs are used to validate data before the BCOs and VCOs are called.

    Parameters:
    command - - the key used to identify the stack to which the specific ValCO is to be mapped.
    handlerClass - - the class of ValCO to be added to the stack. There may be as many different kinds of these added as needed.

    mapCommandToECO

    public static void mapCommandToECO(java.lang.String command,
                                   java.lang.Class handlerClass)
    This method maps a specific command to a Error Control Object (ECO). ECOs are used to notify the user of errors and do any cleanup necessary. ECOs are executed in the UI thread for Android and Java SE implementations. No threading is done for Java EE since Java EE applications are already threaded.

    Parameters:
    command - - the key used to identify the stack to which the specific ECO is to be mapped.
    handlerClass - - the class of ECO to be added to the stack. There may be as many different kinds of these added as needed.
